title: Full Greetings
goal: Use all five vocatives to conduct complete social interactions.

sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

Vocabulary check — translate to English:

1. ti zdani mi     → ?
2. la .bob. cu sutra   → ?
3. la .paris. cu barda   → ?
4. mi klama la zdani   → ?

(Answers: This is my home. Bob is fast. Paris is big. I go home.)

Say the vocatives you know:

  • Hello: coi
  • Goodbye: co'o
  • I am [name]: mi'e

New Material (5-7 min)

Completing the Vocative Set

ki'e — Thanks.

You've learned three vocatives. Today you'll add two more to complete basic social interaction:

Vocative Meaning When to use
coi hello greeting someone
co'o goodbye parting from someone
mi'e I am [name] introducing yourself
ki'e thanks expressing gratitude
je'e acknowledged / you're welcome responding to thanks or confirming receipt

Using ki'e

ki'e expresses gratitude. You can use it alone or with a name:

Lojban English
ki'e Thanks.
ki'e la .alis. Thanks, Alice.
ki'e do Thanks to you. / Thank you.

Using je'e

je'e acknowledges something — it can mean "you're welcome," "got it," or "understood":

Lojban English
je'e Acknowledged. / You're welcome. / Got it.
je'e la .bob. Acknowledged, Bob.

The Thanks Exchange

A typical exchange:

A: ki'e
B: je'e

(A: Thanks. B: You're welcome.)

Or with names:

A: ki'e la .bob.
B: je'e la .alis.

Complete Greeting Sequences

Now you can build full social interactions:

Meeting someone:

A: coi la .bob.         (Hello, Bob.)
B: coi la .alis.        (Hello, Alice.)
A: mi'e .alis.          (I'm Alice.)

Thanking and parting:

A: ki'e la .bob.        (Thanks, Bob.)
B: je'e                 (You're welcome.)
A: co'o                 (Goodbye.)
B: co'o                 (Goodbye.)

Full exchange:

coi la .bob. .i mi'e .alis. .i ki'e .i co'o

(Hello Bob. I'm Alice. Thanks. Goodbye.)

Key Point

ki'e means "thanks" and je'e means "acknowledged/you're welcome." With all five vocatives, you can handle basic social interactions in Lojban.

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Match the Vocative

Match the situation to the vocative:

  1. You arrive and see a friend → ?
  2. You're leaving → ?
  3. Someone gave you something → ?
  4. Someone thanks you → ?
  5. You're introducing yourself → ?
Answers
  1. coi
  2. co'o
  3. ki'e
  4. je'e
  5. mi'e .yourname.

Exercise 2: Complete the Dialogues

Fill in the blanks:

Dialogue 1:

A: coi la .meris.
B: ___ la .tam.         (hello back)
A: mi'e .tam.
B: mi'e ___             (Mary introduces herself)

Dialogue 2:

A: ki'e la .bob.
B: ___                  (acknowledge thanks)
A: co'o
B: ___                  (goodbye)
Answers

Dialogue 1:

A: coi la .meris.
B: coi la .tam.
A: mi'e .tam.
B: mi'e .meris.

Dialogue 2:

A: ki'e la .bob.
B: je'e
A: co'o
B: co'o

Exercise 3: Build a Full Greeting Sequence

Create a complete interaction between you and a friend:

  1. Greet them by name
  2. Introduce yourself
  3. Say one thing about yourself (use Week 1 or 2 vocabulary)
  4. Thank them
  5. Say goodbye

Example:

coi la .sam. .i mi'e .yourname. .i mi klama la zdani .i ki'e .i co'o

Write yours and say it aloud.

sections.content:
Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Practice these exchanges aloud:

Exchange 1: Basic greeting

You: coi la .alis.
Alice: coi la .yourname.

Exchange 2: Thanks

Alice: (gives you something)
You: ki'e la .alis.
Alice: je'e

Exchange 3: Complete meeting

You: coi la .bob. .i mi'e .yourname. .i mi prenu .i co'o

(Hello Bob. I'm [you]. I'm a person. Goodbye.)

Today's Vocab

Cmavo introduced today:

Lojban Function
ki'e thanks (vocative)
je'e acknowledged / you're welcome (vocative)

Complete vocative set:

Vocative Meaning
coi hello
co'o goodbye
mi'e I am [name]
ki'e thanks
je'e acknowledged

Summary

You learned ki'e (thanks) and je'e (acknowledged), completing the five basic vocatives. You can now greet, introduce, thank, acknowledge, and say goodbye — the core of social interaction in Lojban.

Tomorrow preview: Full week integration review — you'll put together everything from Week 2 in realistic mini-conversations and test yourself on all vocabulary.
